thanks, now I know how HttpRecorder.ris correlate to responseStream.

I have another problem which puzzled me for weeks.
It's reported in 
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/1035
and some previous related messages.

And I did some new test, reported as follows.

the problem seems not related to robots.txt,when access 
www.cas.ac.cn/index.htm, also get a time-out. after i set the 
sotimeout to 60s, no time-out for both files. And I roughly measured 
the time to read the stream, it takes about 50s, so time-out occurs.

I copy Heritrix to my PC at home, it access internet via adsl 
without proxy. It runs smoothly, no time-out occurs (sotimeout=20s).

today, I did another test, replacing 
"rec.getRecordedInput().readFullyOrUntil(..);" in FetchHTTP.java
with
"byte[] responseBody = method.getResponseBody();
 System.out.println(new String(responseBody));"

the updated sentences execute without time-out (sotimeout=20s). 

The new sentences will also read content from stream as the previous 
sentence, but it runs smoothly.  So, I think the problem I met, is 
partly related to my working environment(network or software 
setting?), and partly to Heritrix.

Could you give me some suggestions to fix this problem.

thx
